snippet: The Obama administration is taking its mission to radio shows, churches and YouTube to urge people to buy health insurance ahead of the March 31 deadline.
abstract: Obama administration is rolling out aggressive push to get young people, especially African-Americans and Latinos, to buy health insurance through HealthCare.gov ahead of March 31 deadline; effort, including sports-themed internet portal and visits to radio shows and churches nationwide, underscores just how important success of the Affordable Care Act is to Pres Obama's political legacy.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and TANZINA VEGA
byline.contributor: Michael D. Shear reported from Washington, and Tanzina Vega from Tampa, Fla.

lead_paragraph: The Obama administration is taking its mission to radio shows, churches and YouTube to urge people to buy health insurance ahead of the March 31 deadline.

headline.main: Administration Plays to Young in Health Push
headline.print_headline: Administration Plays to Young in Health Push

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
